circumstances: While cruising at an altitude of 7,200 meters over the city of Kazarman on a flight from Bishkek to Osh, the aircraft encountered severe downdrafts and entered an uncontrolled descent during which it lost 2,200 meters and recorded excessive loads of +5.5 g. The crew finally took over control of the airplane and landed safely at Osh Airport. Nevertheless, the aircraft became unserviceable following irreparable structural damages. All nine occupants were injured.
probable_cause: In-flight structural damages caused by severe downdrafts in altitude.
